sentences: Ma vajan abi selle ülesande lahendamiseks.
Ta vajas rohkem aega oma töö valmis saamiseks.
Meil vajab uusi liikmeid meie klubisse.
context: The Estonian word 'vajan' is the first person singular present indicative form of the verb 'vajama', which means 'to need'. It literally translates to 'I need' and is used when expressing a personal requirement or necessity for something. The verb belongs to the -ma conjugation class in Estonian, where the infinitive ends in '-ma'. In this case, 'vajama' changes to 'vajan' for 'I need', while other forms would be 'vad' (he/she/it needs) and 'vame/vavad' (we/they need).
